intro: Acrostichum drynarioides, commonly known as the golden hakea, is a species of fern native to Australia. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, and often golden-colored fronds. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its fronds are pinnately divided and can reach lengths of up to 1 meter. Acrostichum drynarioides is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate coastal conditions.
